Title: Winter 2021/2022 - Food & Bev: Support, Cashier & Events Staff - Kelowna, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Position:
Support, Cashier and Events
Location: Happy Valley Day Lodge
Reports to: Food & Beverage Managers / Supervisors
Employment: Seasonal, Full Time Start Date: Mid-November
Pay Rate: Start @ $15.20/hr End Date: Mid-April
Job Description: Responsible for the day to day maintenance and cleanliness of The Happy Valley Day Lodge. Our Support staff will also service banquet functions, weddings and other group bookings. Cashier in the cafeteria. Provide assistance to other staff across the Food and Beverage Department to help ensure a positive experience for our guests and staff. When serving alcohol, you are required to follow BC liquor laws and participate in our daily ID Pledge, stating that you will ask for 2 pieces of identification from anyone who looks under the age of 40.
Position Requirements/Skills:
Must have a valid Serving it Right Certificate or equivalent by the first day of employment. Dated on or after October 18th, 2018.
Understanding of Duty of Care as it relates to the responsible service of Alcohol.
Required to work flexible hours including nights, weekends and holidays and may be required to work overtime.
To work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Report for work on time.
Maintain a high standard of personal appearance and grooming, which includes wearing the correct uniform/foot wear and name tag while working.
Be familiar with the floor plans of the Lounge/ Cafeteria and Sk8ters.
Notifies the Managers/Supervisors of any maintenance issues that need to be repaired.
Keeps service areas and Guest areas stocked and clean.
Assist with group functions; set up, service, tear down.
Knowledge of SWP & SJP & WHMIS.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Sign ID Pledge daily, stating that you pledge to ID anyone who looks under 40. No exceptions.
Follow opening, closing and daily on-going procedures and checklist.
Clear and wipes all cafeteria/ Sk8ters tables and chairs, floors at all times to maintain high level of cleanliness and customer service.
Ensure cutlery/condiment stands/ Drink fridges are well stocked at all times
Checks all washroom facilities at regular intervals to maintain clean and fresh facilities.
Maintain excellent communication all positions as necessary to promote positive teamwork.
Performs all side work duties as assigned or requested by Managers and or Chef.
Clean windows/ entrance doors as needed
Salt/shovel entrances for guest/staff safety
Empty bins when full and ensure there are bags in the bottom
Maintain the cleanliness of the Garbage/Recycle room
Maintain the cleanliness of the Adventure Park Facilities
Assists team members as needed to promote positive guest experience
Physical Demands:
Spend significant portion of time spent standing and walking
Lift up to 50lbs multiple times a day
Work outside in cold conditions
Location: Big White Ski Resort

Title: Cashier - Langley, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Type: Casual/ Relief/ Part-Time/ Full-Time
The Gateway to Your Future
The cage is the heartbeat of the casino and is a central role in developing your skills and expanding your career opportunities. As a Cashier, you will accurately verify, reconcile, and process currency and chip transactions. If you thrive in an upbeat, busy, and vibrant atmosphere and the chance to be in the action, this role is perfect for you. A willingness to learn, team-player instincts, and a balanced sense of fun and responsibility are all part of what makes for a successful Cashier. While you work hard at maintaining our high standards in service excellence, we provide you with an excellent benefits package and a competitive salary at a national company with more than 27 locations throughout Canada.
We Provide
Full benefits package for full-time employees
Retirement savings plan
Exciting, supportive and fun work environment
Family and friends discounts on travel, tech, food, beverage, and fitness
Development and training opportunities
Key Responsibilities
Count and verify opening and closing floats for all coin, currency, chips, and marketing items.
Exchange foreign and domestic currency.
Counts cash and value chips according to company policies and procedures.
Records transactions in Casino Management Software and verifies printed reports.
What You Bring
Minimum of six months of cash-handling experience.
Ability to add, multiply, and balance floats and spreadsheets.
DealUs In (Phase 1) and Reel Facts VLT training available within 30 days of start (Alberta).
The ability to obtain registration with either the BCLC, AGLC or AGCO (based on province).
Ability to pull, lift, and carry objects such as a cashier tray and can transport a heavy cart.
Ability to stand for long periods.
Good manual dexterity to accurately handle cash, tickets, and chips.
A friendly, polite, patient and courteous energy.
Ability to work on your feet and provide solutions quickly.
Open to working flexible hours, evenings, and weekends.
Why Work With Us?
Gateway celebrates and empowers our team members, who make it all possible. A career at Gateway means working with great people, being recognized for your unique contribution and career advancement opportunities across our 27 locations. Our employees thrive with ongoing training and leadership programs while working in a dynamic and fun environment. See for yourself what it?s like to be on a team that values your vision, skill and energy.
Get to Know Gateway
Gateway Casinos & Entertainment Limited (?Gateway?) is one of the largest and most diversified gaming and entertainment companies in Canada. Across its 27 gaming properties in British Columbia, Ontario and Edmonton, Alberta, Gateway currently employs approximately 8,648 people and boasts approximately 448 table games (including 49 poker tables), 13,887 slots, 85 restaurants and bars and 561 hotel rooms. Gateway is the service provider for the Central, Southwest and North gaming Bundles in Ontario, which includes 11 properties in their portfolio. A multi-pronged growth strategy has seen Gateway diversify and expand its product offering, including developing proprietary casino and restaurant brands, dramatically improving the gaming customer experience while attracting new customers. Some of Gateway's proprietary brands include Match Eatery & Public House, Atlas Steak + Fish and the new Halley's Club. In 2017, Gateway celebrated 25 years in the business of gaming and entertainment in Canada. Further information is available at www.gatewaycasinos.com.
What Is Next
Not the right fit this time? Follow us on our careers social media pages!
Gateway is a proud equal opportunity employer and dedicates itself to Respect, Integrity, Team-Work and Exceptional Customer Service. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free candidate experience and work environment. If you require accommodation at any point during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know.

Title: Cashier and Barista - Tanger Outlets Ottawa - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Are you passionate about bubble tea businesses?
Are you someone who always thrives to grow and accomplish more?
If yes, join us today!
If not now, when?
If not me, who?
Founded in Toronto, Real Fruit Bubble Tea has been committed to making fresh fruit drinks healthy and accessible for anyone to enjoy since 2002. We have numerous locations across Canada and USA. As a rapidly expanding business, we want you to join our team and grow with us, and we can build you up from store manager to regional manager and beyond!
There is huge potential for growth, and we welcome anyone who is up to a challenging yet rewarding journey!
Position Description
As a Barista/Cashier at Real Fruit Bubble Tea, you represent and embody the values and beliefs of the company when delivering the best customer service and quality hand-crafted drinks that Real Fruit is known for.
Duties and Responsibilities
· Provide exceptional customer service; identify customer issues and/or complaints and handle them in a professional manner.
· Prepare every drink in accordance with Real Fruit’s drinks formula and preparation techniques.
· Taste all drinks to ensure that they meet Real Fruit’s high-quality standards.
· Perform daily opening/closing procedures in accordance with Real Fruit’s standards.
· Maintain the cleanliness of the store.
· Help with the preparation to drinks to facilitate the smooth and efficient operations of the store.
· Show initiative to assist management with floor and inventory controls by monitoring reorder points and taking inventory counts.
· Can work through a variety of shifts and maintain a high-energy level.
· Demonstrate professionalism at all times.
· Demonstrate awareness of store goals and takes action to achieve them.
· Perform other related duties as required.
Ideal Candidate Competencies
·
Attitude
: proven entrepreneur spirit of working "on-floor" spontaneously, as to motivate and propel the frontline personnel in person and to serve as the role model for co-workers.
·
Results-Oriented
: demonstrates the ability to consistently perform optimal business results by meeting deadlines and achieving pre-determined goals.
·
Communication
: effectively conveys necessary information and ideas in concise and meaningful exchanges through verbal and written communications.
·
Teamwork/Collaboration
: effectively develops healthy relationships with co-workers and encourages idea-sharing that assists to accomplish goals.
·
Initiative:
proactively seeking opportunities to work outside of job scope to assist various business departments and demonstrates the ability to always go beyond what is required to achieve goals.
·
Personal Adaptability
: demonstrates the ability to welcome and embrace changes and effectively adjusts to newly altered environment within the business.
Expectation of Successful Candidate
· Work well in a team environment as an effective team member
· Able to complete job responsibilities without direct supervision
· Understand the importance of customer service and is customer-focused
· Possess excellent communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills
· Demonstrate strong work ethics: responsible, reliable, punctual, and have high integrity
· Able to work in a fast-paced environment
· Strong hands-on skills
· Is detail-oriented
· Similar prior experience is an asset
If you possess the above qualifications and desire to learn and accomplish more in a welcoming and dynamic organization then you are what we are looking for! Selected candidates will be contacted for an interview.
Real Fruit Bubble Tea Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employers that do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, religion, age, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, provincial or federal laws, rules, or regulations. RFBT's policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.

Title: Cashier (Part-Time) - Calgary, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Summary
The Cashier team member works in a fast-paced environment that involves constant interaction with customers. This position requires delivering friendly and courteous service while processing customer purchases efficiently and correctly. This role involves the operation of a computerized cash register.
Responsibilities and Tasks
Customer Service
Smiles, make eye contact, greets and thanks customers (by name where possible).
Directs customer to the location of requested items.
Suggests value-added and related products to customers to ensure they get home with all they need.
Ends the discussion with the customer using a closing statement (e.g., “Is there anything else I can do for you today?” “Did you find everything you were looking for?” “Thank you for shopping at Canadian Tire!”).
Responds to and handles customer inquiries, requests and concerns in a timely manner, over the phone and in person.
Handles multiple customers in an effective and efficient manner.
Deals with challenging situations and conflict resolution in a professional manner.
Operations
Operates cash register and all point of sales functions.
Processes customer purchases efficiently, following standardized procedures.
Accurately verifies merchandise quantities, descriptions and prices when processing customer purchases.
Balances cash and is aware of amount of cash on hand.
Maintains merchandise around the cash area and ensures that retail basics are executed efficiently (e.g., labels, facing, clean area, etc.).
Takes returns to stock product in respective department.
Reports stolen and damaged goods to Management.
Alerts management to security problems.
Alerts the respective department on any customer inquiry or concern.
Shares opinions and ideas on how to improve store success.
Participates in meetings and all training as required; listens to feedback to improve their own abilities.
Complies with company, store and department policies.
Abides by all health and safety programs and regulations. Reports any observed or potential hazards immediately.
Uses professional language and maintains a professional appearance (e.g., uniform, hygiene, grooming and name tag) when interacting with others.
Completes other tasks, as required.
Requirements
Basic math and typing skills.
Ability to work efficiently with computerized systems.
Ability to work with minimum supervision.
Experience in a customer service role and/or with a Canadian Tire store is considered an asset.
Ability to operate a cash register.

Title: Part-time Sales Associate (some Day Time avalibility is required) - Halifax, NS - Indeed.com
Description:
At Roots,
we look for dynamic individuals who are not only interested in retail and fashion, but who enjoy challenges and share our vision for a safer, cleaner, healthier planet. Roots is not only a brand, it’s a culture and lifestyle.
In addition to our customers, an intrinsic part of our success has always been the people who work here. Our clients and customers need to have confidence that our managers and associates at all levels of the organization have the knowledge, skills and competencies to excel.
Our company depends on systems and processes that support the continued learning and development of our people. Roots is a company in which you can grow and benefit from the great opportunities often available. All members of our team are encouraged to ‘spread their roots’.
Nature & Scope:
Reporting to the Store Manager, the Sales Associate plays a vital role in promoting our core values. The main objective of this position is to provide exceptional service to customers and build relationships with them. The goal is to develop customers for life.
Key Job Responsibilities:
· Display a “customer comes first” attitude. Ensuring that customer loyalty is built and maintained.
· Resolving customer issues effectively at store level in a timely and positive manner.
· Be a team player and contribute to the stores’ success.
· Perform POS (point of sales transactions) and merchandising tasks, such as receiving shipment, replenishment, price markdowns, fitting room upkeep.
· Keep current on our product and service updates.
· Ensure store is visually appealing contributing to company standards through product presentation, replenishment, store housekeeping, store maintenance and visual displays.
· Adhere to all Loss Prevention policies as per guidelines and policies.
Qualifications and Experience Required
· Retail experience preferably in apparel.
· Demonstrated ability to develop relationships with customers.
· Experience with understanding retail operation concepts such as maintaining to store standards, cash handling, and merchandise presentation.
· Self-starter and uses good judgment in all situations.
· Excellent presentation skills in a retail environment.
· Upbeat, optimistic, passionate and friendly.
· Ability to understand the needs of the customer
· Ability to build buy-in to an idea, a decision, an action, a product, or a service.
